text:
Good morning,

We have Apache version 2.0 on a Windows Server 2003 installed and it has 
recently been doing something strange with memory.  We first get complaints of 
performance issues and when we launch Task Manager on the server we see that 
the NP Pool memory is stuck at 4GB.  Once we restart the service in Manage, 
the performance goes back to normal and the NP Pool memory is reset.  We are 
also getting in the Event Viewer a constant error and it goes as follow:
"The Apache service named reported the following error: [Wed Feb 21 00:23:27 
2007] [warn] The Alias directive in C:/Apache2/conf/httpd.conf at line 158 
will probably never match because it overlaps an earlier Alias."  Do you have 
any ideas what could be causing the performance issue or the error?  Thank you 
for your help.
creator: nelsonlaracuente@quadax.com

text:
Created attachment 19620
Event Viewer Error.

This is a screenshot of the event viewer error.  Thank you for your time.
creator: nelsonlaracuente@quadax.com

text:
Created attachment 19621
Apache NP Pool Memory

It just now got stuck in using 4GB of the NP Pool which causes the performance
issues and it will not reset itself.  I just restarted the service and it was
the only way it was reset.  Please help.  Thank you.
creator: nelsonlaracuente@quadax.com
nelsonlaracuente@quadax.com
text: I am sorry but I just found out that the version is 2.0.50.  Thanks.

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
So many changes have occurred since 2.0.50, that it's very difficult
to make any determinations from this sparse report.

We would encourage you to test the latest to see if the specific leak
has been addressed.
